intro: Centaurea omphalotricha, commonly known as the starry centaury, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its striking blue to purple flowers with a distinctive central disk. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun. Its leaves are narrow and grass-like, while its stems are upright and branching. Centaurea omphalotricha is often found in dry, open habitats such as coastal areas and limestone soils.
